titles.title: Catastrophe Savings Accounts Act of 2011
Catastrophe Savings Accounts Act of 2011
To amend the Internal Revenue Code of 1986 to create Catastrophe Savings Accounts.

action.text: Referred to the House Committee on Ways and Means.

bill.summary: Catastrophe Savings Accounts Act of 2011 - Amends the Internal Revenue Code to create tax-exempt catastrophe savings accounts (CSAs). Allows tax-free distributions from CSAs to pay expenses resulting from a presidentially declared major disaster. Limits CSA balances to: (1) $2,000 (for individuals with homeowner insurance deductibles of not more than $1,000); and (2) the lesser of $15,000 or twice a homeowner's insurance deductible (for individuals with deductibles of more than $1,000).
